item.title: A Few Observations on the Marvelous Resilience of Bone & Resilience Engineering - Dr. Richard Cook at the Re-Deploy Conference in 2019
item.description:
Dramatic and mundane examples of resilience have encouraged a search for resilience engineering. The possibility of deliberately exploiting or enhancing resilience is tantalizing. But what exactly is resilience engineering? There are at least two possible forms: first, engineering that exploits what we know about resilient systems and, second, engineering that shapes resilience itself. Bone is useful example of resilience and both types of resilience engineering. The example shows how resilience and resilience engineering are related and also what resilience engineering in other settings might entail.
Richard Cook is a physician, researcher, and educator. He is a co-author of “Operating at the Sharp End: The Complexity of Human Error”, “Adapting to New Technology in the Operating Room”, A Tale of Two Stories: Contrasting Views of Patient Safety, “Gaps in the Continuity of Care and Progress on Patient Safety”, and “‘Going Solid’: A Model of System Dynamics and Consequences for Patient Safety” as well as numerous book chapters and other writings. He is the recipient of the 1999 Peter Kiewit Memorial Award of The Annenberg Foundation and the 2001 McGovern Medal for Medical Writing of the American Medical Writers Association.
Related to:
Video 1 Introduction pt 1 - It's all about viability
item.guid: A Few Observations on the Marvelous Resilience of Bone & Resilience Engineering - Dr. Richard Cook at the Re-Deploy Conference in 2019.md

item.title: Video 1 Introduction pt 1 - It's all about viability
item.description:
Want to know about Resilience Engineering? You're in the right place! This is the first video in the Cognitive Systems Engineering Laboratory's (CSEL) Resilience Engineering 101 Series. Dr. David Woods, a co-founder of Resilience Engineering, gets us kicked off reminding us all that everything must tie back to Viability, and that Viability is sought by both Seeking Opportunity and Handling Challenge.
Related to:
Video 6 Lines of Inquiry
Video 7 The Laws of Fluency and Stretched Systems
item.guid: Video 1 Introduction pt 1 - It's all about viability.md

item.title: Video 2 Tangles, Tradeoffs, and Robust yet Fragile
item.description:
In our second video, we lay out some fundamentals of systems that come out of our base understanding of how systems manage and outmaneuver constraints to seek opportunity and manage challenge to ultimately sustain viability. The first is that viable systems will become increasingly tangled across layers. The second is that they will have to manage tradespaces, making tradeoffs. The third is that their quest for robustness does not insulate them from brittleness, and likely contributes to it.
Related to:
Video 2.5 RYF +
item.guid: Video 2 Tangles, Tradeoffs, and Robust yet Fragile.md

item.title: Video 2.5 RYF +
item.description:
This is a deeper dive video into Robust Yet Fragile (and, of course, the corresponding parts of the Theory of Graceful Extensibility). Dr. David Woods delivers this extended lesson with the help of one of his favorite authors on the topic ... the fantastic Dr. David Woods!
Related to:
Video 2 Tangles, Tradeoffs, and Robust yet Fragile

item.title: Video 3 Synchronization, an antidote to system breakdown
item.description:
Here we discuss how synchronization is necessary both in seeking opportunity and in managing challenges. It is the primary antidote to working at cross-purposes, and together with anticipation is the antidote to saturation and, ultimately, decompensation.
Related to:
Saturation
Beyond Surge Capacity (possible TBR) Video
item.guid: Video 3 Synchronization, an antidote to system breakdown.md

item.title: Video 4 The Science and Pragmatics of RE through the lens of Complexification
item.description:
David Woods starts by describing how successful systems become more complex, then discusses the findings and perspectives of Resilience Engineering (RE) through this lens.
Related to:
Video 1 Introduction pt 1 - It's all about viability
Video 2 Tangles, Tradeoffs, and Robust yet Fragile
Video 9 High-Frequency Trading, a Case Study in Growth and Complexification
item.guid: Video 4 The Science and Pragmatics of RE through the lens of Complexification.md

item.title: Video 5 A Resilience Engineering look at Tradeoffs
item.description:
Tradeoffs are a commonplace thing, but how you think about them can change how you address them, outmaneuver them, and change them. However, you can never eliminate them! David Woods shows the visual technique that we used (borrowed from John Doyle) that helps us communicate what a tradeoff, and a tradespace, really is, and provides insights into how to design new solutions that address the multi-dimensional tradespace of the current system.
Related to:
Video 2 Tangles, Tradeoffs, and Robust yet Fragile
item.guid: Video 5 A Resilience Engineering look at Tradeoffs.md

item.title: Video 6 Lines of Inquiry
item.description:
Dr. David Woods takes a deeper dive into the many lines of inquiry that inform Resilience Engineering. Some are from quite unexpected places! Or maybe they're quite expected, as we've clearly found that there are resilient systems patterns that can be found in systems of all sizes, from biological to social to economic to ecological. We're pretty sure this works at sub-atomic up to celestial as well, but we're not as versed in those. Yet!
Related to:
Video 1 Introduction pt 1 - It's all about viability

item.title: Video 7 The Laws of Fluency and Stretched Systems
item.description:
Related to:
Video 1 Introduction pt 1 - It's all about viability
item.guid: Video 7 The Laws of Fluency and Stretched Systems.md

item.title: Video 8 Tradeoff Between Seeking Opportunity and Managing Challenges
item.description:
In this video, Dr. David Woods goes deeper into how the two fundamental activities for systems viability, seeking opportunity and managing challenges, inevitably come into conflict with each other. He works through how the short-term and long-term time horizons also interact with each other.
Related to:
Video 2 Tangles, Tradeoffs, and Robust yet Fragile
item.guid: Video 8 Tradeoff Between Seeking Opportunity and Managing Challenges.md

item.title: Video 9 High-Frequency Trading, a Case Study in Growth and Complexification
item.description:
Dr. David Woods explores the Resilience Engineering case study laid out in the New York Times Bestseller, Flash Boys: A Wall Street Revolt by Michael Lewis. He dives into the patterns of florescence and adaptation that are exemplified by the co-adaptive cycles that occur within this microcosm of Resilience Engineering.
Related to:
Saturation
item.guid: Video 9 High-Frequency Trading, a Case Study in Growth and Complexification.md
